revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode = football |Year = 2009 |Team = Louisiana Tech Bulldogs |Image = |ImageSize=150 |Conference = Western Athletic Conference |Division = |ShortConference = WAC |BCSRank = |CoachRank = |APRank = |Record = 4â8 |ConfRecord = 3â5 |HeadCoach = [[Derek Dooley (American football coach)|Derek Dooley]] |OffCoach = Frank Scelfo |DefCoach = [[Tommy Spangler]] |OScheme = Multiple, [[Pro Style]] |DScheme = [[Traditions of Louisiana Tech University#GATA|GATA]] |StadiumArena = [[Joe Aillet Stadium]] |Champion = |BowlTourney = |BowlTourneyResult = |ConfChamp = |ConfChampResult = }} {{2009 WAC football standings}} The '''2009 Louisiana Tech Bulldogs football team''' represented [[Louisiana Tech University]] in the [[college football]] [[2009 NCAA Division I FBS football season|season of 2009]]. LA Tech competed in the [[Western Athletic Conference]] and played their home games at [[Joe Aillet Stadium]] in [[Ruston, LA]]. The team was coached by [[Derek Dooley (American football coach)|Derek Dooley]], who was in his third year with the program. The Bulldogs finished the season 4â8 and 3â5 in [[2009 WAC football season|WAC]] play. ==Before the season== ===Recruiting===

===T-Day spring game=== {{Linescore Amfootball| |Road=White |R1=0 |R2=0 |R3=0 |R4=0 |Home='''Red''' |H1=0 |H2=14 |H3=0 |H4=7 }} On April 11, 2009, the Red Team beat the White Team 21-0 at [[Joe Aillet Stadium]] with 3,042 fans in attendance. ESPN Radio's Sean Fox coached the Red Team, and Nick White, also from ESPN Radio, coached the White Team. After a scoreless first quarter, quarterback Steven Ensminger completed a 40-yard pass to tight end Dennis Morris on a trick play to put the Red Team in scoring position. Running Back Daniel Porter scored on a 2-yard touchdown run to put the Red Team up 6-0. Kicker Joel Hall connected on the extra point to make it 7-0. With 1:08 left in the first half, Ensminger completed a 68-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver Cruz Williams to put the Red Team ahead 13-0. Kicker Dale Wallace converted the extra point to make the score 14-0 Red Team going into halftime. Running back Zach Booker scored on a 45-yard touchdown run with 3:28 left in the game to increase the Red Team's lead to 20-0. Hall completed the extra point to make the final score 21-0. Red Team Linebacker Adrien Cole led all tacklers with nine. Red Team Defensive lineman Ramone Randle recorded two sacks, and cornerback Olajuwon Paige recorded two interceptions for the Red Team.{{cite web |url=http://www.latechsports.com/sports/m-footbl/recaps/041109aaa.html |title=Red Team Defense Too Much For White Team |publisher=Louisiana Tech University |accessdate=2009-04-11|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5iejLts05|archivedate=2009-07-30|deadurl=no}} ==Schedule==
